Question
========

Consider the following data graphic from the *Economist* article, "[Temporary economic downturns have long-lasting consequences](https://www.economist.com/graphic-detail/2018/10/19/temporary-economic-downturns-have-long-lasting-consequences)":

![](https://www.economist.com/sites/default/files/20181020_WOC966.png)

Suppose that this data graphic was created in `ggplot2`. Consider *only the left-most panel titled "Gender"*. 
Which of the following statements are true? 

Answerlist
----------
* The `color` aesthetic is mapped to the "gender" variable.
* The `color` aesthetic is mapped to the "reduction of earnings" variable.
* Vertical position is mapped to the "reduction of earnings" variable.
* Vertical position is mapped to the "years since graduation" variable.
* Horizontal position is mapped to the "years since graduation" variable.
* Horizontal position is mapped to the "reduction of earnings" variable.
* The `geom_line()` function is used to draw the lines.
* The `geom_point()` function is used to draw the lines.


Solution
========

Answerlist
----------
* True.
* False.
* True.
* False.
* True.
* False.
* True.
* False.
